Project Handled- 5 
 
Project Name: Alcatraz Security System 
Client:  Dell 
Team Size: 4 
Duration: May 2018 to till date 
Role: Sr. Database Analyst 

 
Description: 

Alcatraz is the Global Application Security System. The security for all the applications can be managed 
from this one central site. Once any application gets configured with Alcatraz Security Manager, the roles, 
privileges and users can be customized as per the application's requirement. Based on this security mapping, 
the behavior gets changed for the particular logged user. Once the standard user sends the access request for 
a particular application, the user and admin will get the email notification and the request moves to the admin 
dashboard. Then any admin user can approve/reject the access request and the same email notification will 
be received back by both user and admin. To access this application, we have mainly 3 roles like IT site Admin, 
Admin User and Standard User. Each role will perform its own activities.  

 

Functionality: 

• IT site Admin will configure the new application, adding new roles, adding admin users & privileges under 
each role. It also allows us to assign primary contacts for each application. It maintains the 
Announcements to all the uses and Instructions for only IT Admin users. 

• Admin Users can have the privilege like approving / rejecting the Application request which will be 
requested from the users. It also maintains the history for the same. 

• Standard Users can only have send access request and cancel request for particular application. 

 

 Roles and Responsibilities: 

▪ Responsible for developing packages, procedures, functions & triggers as per the requirement. 
▪ Modifying the existing query and reducing the cost doing performance tuning. 
▪ Creation of database objects like table, views, indexes and sequences. 
▪ Wrote SQL queries using joins, sub-queries and correlated sub queries of retrieve data from the 

database. 
▪ Doing Migration between old Alcatraz and New Alcatraz with different table structure. 
▪ Moving data using Excel import-export from one Db to another Db and one schema to different Schema 

in Same Db.

Project Handled- 2 
Project Name: Ware House Management (WMS) 
Client:  Maruti, Gati 
Team Size: 6 
Duration: Jul 2015 to Dec 2016 
Role: Oracle developer 
 
Description: 
 A Warehouse management system or WMS is a key part of supply chain and primarily aims to control 
the movement and storage of materials within a warehouse and process the associated transaction, including 
shipping, receiving, put-away and picking. The systems also direct and optimize stock put-away based on real-
time information about the status of bin utilization. Once data has been collected, there is either batch 
synchronization with or a real-time wireless transmission to a central database. The database can then provide 
useful reports about the status of goods in the warehouse. 
   The objective of a warehouse management system is to provide a set of computerized 
procedures to handle the receipt of stock and returns into a warehouse facility, model and manage the logical 
representation of the physical storage facilities (e.g. racking etc), manage the stock within the facility and enable 
a seamless link to order processing and logistics management in order to pick, pack and ship product out of 
the facility.

▪ Involved in modifying various existing packages, procedures, functions, triggers according to the new 

business needs. 
▪ Wrote SQL queries using joins, sub-queries and correlated sub queries of retrieve data from the 

database.

Project Name: Ware House Management (WMS) 
Client:  Maruti, Gati 
Team Size: 6 
Duration: Jul 2015 to Dec 2016 
Role: Oracle developer 
 
Description: 
 A Warehouse management system or WMS is a key part of supply chain and primarily aims to control 
the movement and storage of materials within a warehouse and process the associated transaction, including 
shipping, receiving, put-away and picking. The systems also direct and optimize stock put-away based on real-
time information about the status of bin utilization. Once data has been collected, there is either batch 
synchronization with or a real-time wireless transmission to a central database. The database can then provide 
useful reports about the status of goods in the warehouse. 
   The objective of a warehouse management system is to provide a set of computerized 
procedures to handle the receipt of stock and returns into a warehouse facility, model and manage the logical 
representation of the physical storage facilities (e.g. racking etc), manage the stock within the facility and enable 
a seamless link to order processing and logistics management in order to pick, pack and ship product out of 
the facility.

business needs. 
▪ Wrote SQL queries using joins, sub-queries and correlated sub queries of retrieve data from the 

database.
